alert.note: Alert for Cook; DuPage; Will (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 11 at 11:30AM CDT until September 11 at 12:15PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR CENTRAL COOK, DUPAGE AND NORTHWESTERN WILL COUNTIES... At 1130 AM CDT, local law enforcement reported flooding of roads due to heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement. IMPACT...Rapid-onset flooding of creeks, streams, drainage ditches, streets, underpasses, low-lying areas, and other poor drainage areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Chicago, Aurora, Naperville, Cicero, Evanston, Bolingbrook, Skokie, Des Plaines, Orland Park, Oak Lawn, Berwyn, Wheaton, Oak Park, Downers Grove, Glenview, Elmhurst, Lombard, Ohare Airport, Carol Stream and Romeoville. While rainfall has started to diminish, additional scattered showers are expected to continue through tonight. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Expect flooding of creeks, ditches, canals, and storm sewers, as well roadways, underpasses, and other poor drainage areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
